00003 /**
00004  * @brief HTML drop-down list class.
00005  * 
00006  * This class is used to generate HTML drop-down lists.
00007  * 
00008  * @class       Boo_Html_Select
00009  * @license     http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.txt GNU General Public License
00010  * @link        http://code.ramaboo.com/ Boo Framework
00011  * @copyright   2009 David Singer
00012  * @author      David Singer <david@ramaboo.com>
00013  * @version     1.7.0
00014  * 
00015  * @todo Add support for selecting multiple items.
00016  * @todo Fix issues with htmlentities.
00017  */
00018 
00019 class Boo_Html_Select extends Boo_Html_FormControl {
00020     /**
00021      * @brief The select elements data.
00022      * 
00023      * Implemented as an array where the key is the option value and the value is the text displayed.
00024      */
00025     protected $data = array();
00026     
00027     /**
00028      * @brief The title of the select element.
00029      * 
00030      * Will be displayed as the first item in the select list if set and will contain a value of an empty string by default.
00031      */
00032     protected $title = array('name' => '', 'value' => '');  
00033     
00034     /**
00035      * @brief The default key.
00036      * 
00037      * Overided by posted values or selected key.
00038      */
00039     protected $default = '';
00040     
00041     /**
00042      * @brief The selected key.
00043      * 
00044      * Overrides posted value and default key.
00045      */
00046     protected $selected = '';
00047     
00048     /**
00049      * @brief Default constructor.
00050      * @return void.
00051      */
00052     public function __construct() {
00053         parent::__construct('select');
00054     }
00055     
00056     /**
00057      * @brief Sets the lists data.
00058      * 
00059      * @param array $data The data.
00060      * @return bool Returns TRUE on sccess, FALSE otherwise.
00061      */
00062     public function setData(array $data) {
00063         if (empty($data)) {
00064             trigger_error('Data should not be empty, try Boo_Html_Select::clearData()', E_USER_NOTICE);
00065             return false;
00066         } else {
00067             $this->data = $data;
00068             return true;
00069         }
00070     }
00071     
00072     /**
00073      * @brief Clears the lists data.
00074      * 
00075      * @return bool Function always returns TRUE.
00076      */
00077     public function clearData() {
00078         $this->data = array();
00079         return true;
00080     }
00081     
00082     /**
00083      * @brief Gets the lists data.
00084      * 
00085      * @return array The data.
00086      */
00087     public function getData() { return $this->data; }
00088     
00089     /**
00090      * @brief Sets the title.
00091      * 
00092      * @param string $name The name of the title (displayed to user).
00093      * @param string $value (optional) The value for the title.
00094      * @return bool Returns TRUE on success, FALSE otherwise.
00095      */
00096     public function setTitle($name, $value = null) {
00097         $name = trim($name);
00098         $value = trim($value);
00099         
00100         if (Boo_Validator::isNull($name)) {
00101             trigger_error("Name {$name} can not be null (or a null like value)", E_USER_WARNING);
00102             return false;
00103         } else {
00104             $this->title['name'] = $name;
00105             $this->title['value'] = $value;
00106             return true;
00107         }
00108     }
00109     
00110     /**
00111      * @brief Determins if a title is set.
00112      * 
00113      * @return bool Returns TRUE if title is set, FALSE otherwise.
00114      */
00115     public function hasTitle() {
00116         if (!Boo_Validator::isNull($this->title['name'])) {
00117             return true;
00118         } else {
00119             return false;
00120         }
00121     }
00122     
00123     /**
00124      * @brief Gets the title.
00125      * 
00126      * API compatibility.
00127      * 
00128      * @return string The title.
00129      */
00130     public function getTitle() { return $this->getTitleName(); }
00131     
00132     /**
00133      * @breif Gets the titles name (as seen by the user).
00134      * 
00135      * @return string The titles name.
00136      */
00137     public function getTitleName() { return $this->title['name']; }
00138     
00139     /**
00140      * @brief Gets the titles value.
00141      * 
00142      * @return string The titles value.
00143      */
00144     public function getTitleValue() { return $this->title['value']; }
00145     
00146     /**
00147      * @brief Sets the default key.
00148      * 
00149      * @param string $key The default key.
00150      * @return bool Returns TRUE on success, FALSE on error.
00151      */
00152     public function setDefault($key) {
00153         $key = trim($key);
00154         if (!$this->hasData()) {
00155             if (BOO_DEBUG) { trigger_error('Data should be set before calling this function, try Boo_Html_Select::setData(), error checking skipped', E_USER_NOTICE); }
00156             $this->default = $key;
00157             return true;
00158         }
00159         
00160         if (array_key_exists($key, $this->data)) {
00161             $this->default = $key;
00162             return true;
00163         } else {
00164             trigger_error("Key {$key} was not found in data", E_USER_WARNING);
00165             return false;
00166         }
00167     }
00168     
00169     /**
00170      * @brief Adds key to list of default items.
00171      * 
00172      * This feature is not yet implemented! Added for future API compatibility.
00173      * 
00174      * @param string $key The default key.
00175      * @return bool Returns TRUE on success, FALSE on failure.
00176      * 
00177      * @todo Finish this function when updating class to support multiple selects.
00178      */
00179     public function addDefault($key) {
00180         return $this->setDefault($key);
00181     }
00182     
00183     /**
00184      * @brief Gets the default key.
00185      * 
00186      * @return string The default key.
00187      */
00188     public function getDefault() { return $this->default; }
00189     
00190     /**
00191      * @brief Sets the selected key.
00192      * 
00193      * @param string $key The selected key.
00194      * @return bool Returns TRUE on success, FALSE on error.
00195      */
00196     function setSelected($key) {
00197         $key = trim($key);
00198         if (!$this->hasData()) {
00199             trigger_error('Data should be set before calling this function, try Boo_Html_Select::setData(), error checking skipped', E_USER_NOTICE);
00200             $this->selected = $key;
00201             return true;
00202         }
00203         
00204         if (array_key_exists($key, $this->data)) {
00205             $this->selected = $key;
00206             return true;
00207         } else {
00208             trigger_error("Key {$key} was not found in data", E_USER_WARNING);
00209             return false;
00210         }
00211     }
00212     
00213     /**
00214      * @brief Adds key to list of selected items.
00215      * 
00216      * This feature is not yet implemented! Added for future API compatibility.
00217      * 
00218      * @param string $key The selected key.
00219      * @return bool Returns TRUE on success, FALSE on failure.
00220      * 
00221      * @todo Finish this function when updating class to support multiple selects.
00222      */
00223     public function addSelected($key) {
00224         return $this->setSelected($key);
00225     }
00226     
00227     /**
00228      * @brief Gets the selected key.
00229      * 
00230      * @return string The selected key.
00231      */
00232     public function getSelected() { return $this->selected; }
00233     
00234     /**
00235      * @brief Sets the default index.
00236      * Zero based.
00237      * 
00238      * @warning This function relies on the internal order of the data array. This can be dangerous.
00239      * 
00240      * @param int $index The default index.
00241      * @return bool Returns TRUE on success, FALSE otherwise.
00242      */
00243     public function setDefaultIndex($index) {
00244         $index = (int) $index;
00245         
00246         if ($index < 0) {
00247             trigger_error("Index {$index} is negative, only postive values are acceptable", E_USER_WARNING);
00248             return false;
00249         }
00250         
00251         if (!$this->hasData()) {
00252             trigger_error('Data should be set before calling this function, try Boo_Html_Select::setData()', E_USER_WARNING);
00253             return false;
00254         }
00255         
00256         $count = 0;
00257         foreach($this->data as $key=>$value) {
00258             if ($count == $index) {
00259                 return $this->setDefault($key);
00260             }
00261             $count++;
00262         }
00263         
00264         // index is outside the bounds of the array
00265         return false;
00266     }
00267     
00268     /**
00269      * @brief Gets the default index.
00270      * 
00271      * * Zero based.
00272      * 
00273      * @warning This function relies on the internal order of the data array. This can be dangerous.
00274      * 
00275      * @return mixed Returns default index on success, FALSE on failure.
00276      */
00277     public function getDefaultIndex() {
00278         if (Boo_Validator::isNull($this->default)) {
00279             trigger_error('Default has not be set, try Boo_Html_Select::setDefault()', E_USER_ERROR);
00280             return false;
00281         }
00282         
00283         $count = 0;
00284         foreach ($this->data as $key=>$value) {
00285             if ($key == $this->default) {
00286                 return $count;
00287             }
00288             $count++;
00289         }
00290         
00291         return false;
00292     }
00293     
00294     /**
00295      * @brief Sets the selected index.
00296      * 
00297      * Zero based.
00298      * 
00299      * @warning This function relies on the internal order of the data array. This can be dangerous.
00300      * 
00301      * @param int $index The selected index.
00302      * @return bool Returns TRUE on success, FALSE otherwise.
00303      */
00304     public function setSelectedIndex($index) {
00305         $index = (int) $index;
00306         
00307         if ($index < 0) {
00308             trigger_error("Index {$index} is negative, only postive values are acceptable", E_USER_WARNING);
00309             return false;
00310         }
00311         
00312         if (!$this->hasData()) {
00313             trigger_error('Data should be set before calling this function, try Boo_Html_Select::setData()', E_USER_WARNING);
00314             return false;
00315         }
00316         
00317         $count = 0;
00318         foreach($this->data as $key => $value) {
00319             if ($count == $index) {
00320                 return $this->setSelected($key);
00321             }
00322             $count++;
00323         }
00324         
00325         // index is outside the bounds of the array
00326         return false;
00327     }
00328     
00329     /**
00330      * @brief Gets the selected index.
00331      * 
00332      * Zero based.
00333      * 
00334      * @warning This function relies on the internal order of the data array. This can be dangerous.
00335      * 
00336      * @return mixed Returns selected index on success, FALSE on failure.
00337      */
00338     public function getSelectedIndex() {
00339         if (Boo_Validator::isNull($this->selected)) {
00340             trigger_error('Selected has not be set, try Boo_Html_Select::setSelected()', E_USER_ERROR);
00341             return false;
00342         }
00343         
00344         $count = 0;
00345         foreach ($this->data as $key => $value) {
00346             if ($key == $this->selected) {
00347                 return $count;
00348             }
00349             $count++;
00350         }
00351         
00352         return false;
00353     }
00354     
00355     /**
00356      * @brief Gets index of posted value.
00357      * 
00358      * @warning This function relies on the internal order of the data array. This can be dangerous.
00359      * 
00360      * @return mixed Returns posted index on success, FALSE otherwise.
00361      */
00362     public function getPostedIndex() {
00363         $pv = $this->getPostedValue();
00364         
00365         if ($pv === false) {
00366             trigger_errror('Not a postback, can not continue', E_USER_ERROR);
00367             return false;
00368         }
00369         
00370         $count = 0;
00371         foreach ($this->data as $key => $value) {
00372             if ($key == $pv) {
00373                 return $count;
00374             }
00375             $count++;
00376         }
00377         
00378         return false;
00379     }
00380     
00381     /**
00382      * @brief Returns the HTML for the list.
00383      * 
00384      * @param array $attrs [optional] Array of attributes.
00385      * @return string The HTML for list the list.
00386      */
00387     function html(array $attrs = array()) {
00388         if (Boo_Validator::isNull($this->getAttr('name'))) {
00389             trigger_error('Attribute name cannot be null (or null like value)', E_USER_ERROR);
00390             return false;
00391         }
00392         
00393         if (Boo_Validator::isNull($this->getAttr('id'))) {
00394             trigger_error('Attribute id cannot be null (or null like value)', E_USER_ERROR);
00395             return false;
00396         }
00397         
00398         $this->applyAttrs($attrs);
00399         
00400         $tmp = '';
00401         $tmp .= $this->htmlOpen() . "\n";
00402 
00403         // add title if there is one
00404         if ($this->hasTitle()) {
00405             // first option
00406             $tmp .= '<option value="' . $this->title['value'] . '">'. $this->title['name'] . "</option>\n";
00407         }
00408         
00409         if ($this->isSticky()) {
00410             // list is sticky
00411             
00412             if (empty($this->data)) {
00413                 trigger_error('Data is empty and the list is sticky, this will produce an empty list', E_USER_NOTICE);
00414                 // do not return
00415             }
00416             
00417             $name = $this->getAttr('name');
00418             if (substr($name, (strlen($name) - 2), 2) == '[]') {
00419                 // remove []
00420                 $name = substr($name, 0, -2);
00421             }
00422             
00423             $selected = false;
00424             
00425             // try default, post and selected override default
00426             if (!Boo_Validator::isNull($this->default)) {
00427                 $selected = $this->default;
00428             }
00429             
00430             // try post, use value if found
00431             if (array_key_exists($name, $_POST)) {
00432                 if (is_array($_POST[$name])) {
00433                     foreach ($_POST[$name] as $key => $value) {
00434                         $selected[$key] = $value;
00435                     }
00436                 } else {
00437                     $selected = $_POST[$name];
00438                 }
00439             }
00440             
00441             // try selected, selected overrides post
00442             if (!Boo_Validator::isNull($this->selected)) {
00443                 $selected = $this->selected;
00444             }
00445             
00446             foreach($this->data as $key => $value) {
00447                 if (is_array($selected)) {
00448                     // selected is an array
00449                     // multiple items selected
00450                     if (in_array($key, $selected)) {
00451                         $tmp .= "<option value=\"{$key}\" selected=\"selected\">{$value}</option>\n";
00452                     } else {
00453                         $tmp .= "<option value=\"{$key}\">{$value}</option>\n";
00454                     }
00455                 } else {
00456                     // single item selected
00457                     if ((string) $selected === (string) $key) { // if you use == then 0 will equal null, this hack seems to work
00458                         $tmp .= "<option value=\"{$key}\" selected=\"selected\">{$value}</option>\n";
00459                     } else {
00460                         $tmp .= "<option value=\"{$key}\">{$value}</option>\n";
00461                     }
00462                 }
00463             }
00464         } else {
00465             // list is not sticky
00466             foreach($this->data as $key => $value) {
00467                 $tmp .= "<option value=\"{$key}\">{$value}</option>\n";
00468             }
00469         }
00470         
00471         $tmp .= $this->htmlClose() . "\n";
00472         return $tmp;
00473     }
00474     
00475     /**
00476      * @brief Determins if the list has data.
00477      * 
00478      * @return bool Returns TRUE if data is set, FALSE otherwise.
00479      */
00480     public function hasData() { return !empty($this->data); }

00483     /**
00484      * @brief HTML select of all US states.
00485      * 
00486      * @return Boo_Html_Select The HTML select of all US states.
00487      */
00488     public static function htmlStatesSelect() {
00489         $tmp = new Boo_Html_Select;
00490         $tmp->setAttr('id', 'state');
00491         $tmp->setAttr('name', 'state');
00492         $tmp->setTitle('Select State');
00493         $tmp->setSticky(true); // the select element will remember its value from postbacks
00494         $tmp->setData(Boo_Validator::getStates()); // built in array of every state
00495         return $tmp;
00496     }
00497     
00498     /**
00499      * @brief HTML select of all countries.
00500      * 
00501      * @return Boo_Html_Select The HTML select of all countries.
00502      */
00503     public static function htmlCountriesSelect() {
00504         $tmp = new Boo_Html_Select;
00505         $tmp->setAttr('id', 'country');
00506         $tmp->setAttr('name', 'country');
00507         $tmp->setTitle('Select Country');
00508         $tmp->setSticky(true); // the select element will remember its value from postbacks
00509         $tmp->setData(Boo_Validator::getCountries()); // built in array of every state
00510         return $tmp;
00511     }
